intro: [WRONG START] Hieracium gigantellum subsp. podkumokose, commonly known as the Podkumokense Hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows, grasslands, and forest edges. The plant features basal rosettes of stiff, hairy leaves and produces yellow composite flowers in late summer. It is characterized by its large, showy inflorescences and is often found in regions with temperate climates. Due to its ornamental appeal, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain environments.
